critique: Initial assessment of emotions conveyed in the document. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of reassurance and confidence in his leadership during a national emergency. He aims to convey a sense of decisive action to protect national defense. Joy is low as the situation is serious. Sadness is moderate due to the disruption caused by the strike. Anger is moderate towards those disrupting production. Fear is high due to the threat to national defense. Disgust is moderate towards the actions of the striking workers. Surprise is low as the situation seems to be a predictable outcome of the labor dispute. Revised scores based on a more careful reading: Joy: 1, Sadness: 3, Anger: 4, Fear: 6, Disgust: 3, Surprise: 2
